ratings.comment: Very absent-minded Prof, but funny guy and if you show up to class and put some effort into what you do (do the homework, participate in class, keep up with readingsvideo watchings), you'll get at least an AB. He very much dislikes grading anyone below a B; he'll only do that if you don't show up to class or don't turn things in.
Professor James runs a very fun class! He always opens class with a song and encourages group work. It's not a hard class, and if you show up, you'll enjoy the class.

Professor James laughs at students for saying the wrong word or saying something incoherent and often is extremely unhelpful. He asks the class what a certain word is in German and no one knows the answer, so instead of telling the class, he skips over it and never tells the class. Lectures are really boring and you don't learn much in class.

Professor James laughs at students for saying the wrong word or saying something incoherent and often is extremely unhelpful. He asks the class what a certain word is in German and no one knows the answer, so instead of telling the class, he skips over it and never tells the class. Lectures are really boring and you don't learn much in this class.

Good professor all around for the most part. The class is really easy and Prof James isn't a hard grader at all and is a nice guy. You have to show up for class but Prof James tries to make it engaging and interesting.
Tons of useless work, 10+ page HW assignments. Never discussed in class, does not help the students learn

The class was not hard, just tons of work. Herr James is fun as a professor, sometimes not clear in giving directions but he tries to make class interesting. There was "secret homework" you had to do to prepare for class on top of the homework that was already due, but otherwise quizes were not hard as long as you studied specified material
Very enthusiastic and easy grader. Pretty easy A if you have a decent grasp on the language

Always keep a dictionary with you and he'll like you. He flutters around the classroom quite alot. Easy-going and low stress class. However, you won't learn anything new. If you want to learn more, i'd suggest taking a class with Frau Love, even though she's tougher grader.

Great Professor! He's funny and tries to make class interesting. He cares for his students and lets you rewrite essays to improve your grade. He also gives you idea of what's going to be on quizes/exams so you know what to study and speaks only in German, so you get to hear German a lot. It was mostly review but I enjoyed Herr James class.
Herr James is very funny, easy to talk to, and an overall great person. His class is great for review of grammar, and he lets you do rewrites on your essays.

He's a nice guy-fun class, lots of interesting material. He speaks 100% in German and e-mails A LOT. Homework got a bit tedious, but it was tolerable with two nights to do it. Watch out for the Fridays with tests, homework, and essays due!!

C. James is a good guy.  You will not learn any new material pertaining to speaking/reading.  You will only expand on what you already know.  A lot of reading and writing.   Not bad class at all.  I benefitted greatly from his redo-essays policy. Study for his easy exams and you should do well.

Love him!  Such an amazing teacher, very easy class.  If you are taking 225 with him, do not think you are going to learn a lot, because you will not.  Good class to get retros for if you are an incoming freshman!
LOVE this man. Charles is fun, caring, very smart, and extremely knowledgeable! TAKE HIS CLASSES!

Professor James is so funny! If you have a chance to take him, I really recommend it.  There is usually some sort of writing assingment and/or reading that you have to do.  nothing is too difficult.  He let's you redo essays and his exams are very fair.
Great professor.  Very animated and fun.  Nice guy outside of class, too.   I really enjoyed this class.
The exams he has are pretty easy as long as you put a little time into studying.  The hard work is writing essays, but he gives you the chance to correct them after you turn them in.
